intro: Centropogon formosus, commonly known as the Hawaiian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually bright yellow or orange. Centropogon formosus is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the islands.
